titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Pamela S. Wallace (b. 1947) is an anthropologist who studies the Yuchi tribe of Native Americans. She has written on Yuchi demographic and social history. Her master's thesis was entitled "The 1898 Creek Census Cards: A Demographic/Social Structure Analysis of the Yuchi Indians" (University of Oklahoma, 1993). Her Ph.D. dissertation was titled Yuchi Social History since World War II : Political Symbolism in Ethnic Identity (University of Oklahoma, 1998).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Pamela Wallace related to her study of the Yuchi tribe. Materials include: field notes, with outlines; audio interviews of tribe members with Wallace's notes and abstracts of the interviews; genealogical information on tribe members; photograph albums; articles by Wallace and others on the Yuchi tribe; a copy of Wallace's master's thesis; minutes, correspondence, and notes from Euchee (Yuchi) Tribe of Indians meetings in the 1990s (earlier meeting minutes are present as photocopies); articles and lecture notes on anthropological topics; copies of Wallace's outgoing correspondence (1990s); records of Wallace's membership in various academic and cultural organizations; and agendas and notes from professional conferences.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
